reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very lucky to be able to book 4 nights, with very short notice. We stayed 3 nights in their "cottage" which was a fully stocked 2 bedroom house behind the main house. Our last night was in a room in the main house. Both were great but the cottage was the best. We loved having the space. Ike and Jim really make you feel at home. We loved being visited by their lively dogs and from the cottage we had a lovely view of their vegetable gardens. We met some very pleasant people at breakfast and shared travel stories. The Mas is in quiet, rural area but still close to towns with restaurants and stores and very convenient to visit Arles, Avignon, St. Remy, etc.
reviews.title: A Lucky Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are an American visiting Provence, I would highly recommend staying at Mas. Jim and Ike are amazing hosts. They will do anything to make sure your visit is enjoyable. The prepare full gourmet breakfasts, but the best part is the everyone staying at the B&B eats together in the dining room at a large table. This allows grat discussions about what to do that day and fosters new friendships.
reviews.title: great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the warm hospitality of the hosts, to the great premises, our stay at the Mas was fantastic. We would go back in a heartbeat (this time remembering to rent a car!) and explore more of the beautiful countryside and towns the surround Arles. Thanks to Jim and Ike for everything!
reviews.title: A wonderful stay in a wonderful place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked the entire place for a week and had our wedding in the garden surrounded by close family and friends amidst the lavender and a rose trellis, with Jim as our minister.Such fun - A destination wedding is the way to go!!
reviews.title: Dream Wedding in Provence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Jim and Ike made us feel so special, every single day. They really went above and beyond the call of duty, taking us on marvelous site seeing trips at no charge, and picking fresh figs and apricots for our breakfasts every morning. We loved every minute of our stay and we look at our wedding album so fondly. We would love to go back some day and stroll down those lovely country roads with vistas just like a Van Gogh painting. It all could not have been more perfect.
reviews.title: Jim and Ike Make this Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent four nights at Mas du Petit Grava and found Jim and Ike to be gracious hosts and most helpful with recommendations for dining and suggestions for day trips in the area. Arles was crowded with holiday visitors highlighted by bull fights, but we found many other places to experience the area without the crowds. Jim and Ike feted us with an early anniversary champagne toast which was a lovely gesture. Marie & Jim Franklin, Ridge, MD
reviews.title: Easter/Spring Celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was a spectacular find in the countryside. Ike & Jim could not have been more gracious and welcoming. We truly felt like we were home with our family. In fact it was better than home. Candlelight with our fabulous home cooked breakfasts, thoughtful and informative conversations, a great tour of Van Gogh's life in Arles and to top it off they shared their Thanksgiving dinner with us. It was a very special Thanksgiving with our new friends. Anya & Bela (sp?) were loving and sweet. The setting is beautiful and we can't wait to go back and relax. We toured alot this trip - next time - May in the south of France relaxing with our new friends is our choice
reviews.title: Gracious, Warm & Welcoming ! C'est Magnifique !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We called Ike and Jim after reading about their place in Rick Steve's guide. We arrived later that afternoon (Monday), really only planning to stay a night maybe 2 as we worked our way up the coast of Southern France... by the time we left Friday morning (which was all the time we had in France) we were already hoping for a return trip.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I tried to explain to friends what our stay was like and could only sum it up by saying that we were actually sad to leave; like we were leaving family and not recent acquaintances.
reviews.title: A Special Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay with Ike and Jim at Mas du Petit Grava. We only stayed for two nights and it was definitely not long enough. The house and its surroundings are beautiful. We particularly enjoyed the sunflower patch behind the house. Ike and Jim were wonderful hosts. The breakfasts that they prepared were delicious. We were able to sit outside to enjoy the meal, take in the scenery and talk with other guests. We also truly appreciated their helpful advice for a high speed tour of the area. Don't miss the village of Les Baux and the Camargue! We will be back!
reviews.title: A place we would return to in a heartbeat....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stumbled across Mas du petit grava while planning our trip to Provence. What a lucky, lucky find. Stay at this place and you'll see why everyone goes gaga over this part of the world This inn is situated on a lovely property surrounded by fruit trees and a beautifully landscaped pool. The inn itself was built in the 1700s - a stone farmhouse surrounded by neighboring stone farmhouses - that was lovingly restored. It is modestly luxurious, but more importantly, authentic in its design. It really feels like you are somewhere different, like you are in Provence, when you are staying there. But the best part of our stay were our hosts, Jim and Ike, who went out of their way to make sure you were spending your day well, heading to the right restaurant, etc. And they set a wonderful tone that enables you to easily meet all of the other guests in the inn either during their lovely breakfast or at cocktail hour. Jim and Ike are really good souls, excellent hosts, and great guides to the area. I couldnt recommend Mas du Petit Grava more highly.
reviews.title: Beyond fabulous

reviews.title: Fabulous place, great local and BEST breakfasts of our trip!

reviews.text: The quality of the breakfast is the best I've had. All I can say is that I
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I can hardly add to the wonderful reviews but feel so strongly about the mas and Jim & Ike that I am compelled to add my bit. A friend and I spent 4 nights in the cottage which was offered when the twin bed room was unavailable. We didn't really take advantage since we also chose the all-inclusive offer. We had Jim as our guide for our entire stay and had all our meals included. Sadly Jim said that we were probably the last to be able to enjoy that as they are so busy that there is no longer time to provide the service. The mas is beautiful but the hosts REALLy are the reason to spend time here.
reviews.title: Terrific stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The situation is quiet, the pool available, the breakfast is full of farm fresh and home baked goodies, the hosts, Ike and Jim are caring and extremely helpful. It is like being with good friends, and not having to help with the dishes.
reviews.title: Beautifully situated, concerned hosts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a relaxing welcoming place, Ike and Jim are fantastic hosts and the inn and the grounds are truely amazing. Breakfasts are out of this world! Both Jim and Ike are so knowledgable about the area -- where to eat, what to do. It was like having family to visit in France! Loved every second of the time there!
reviews.title: When are you ever going to stay in a 250 year old house? -- fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed with Jim and Ike and their two fantastic Borzoi's at Mas du Petit Grava for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. From the moment of booking I knew this place would be the favorite of the trip based on Jim's communication. My husband and I stayed in the cottage which was perfect! We had a full kitchen which was perfect for snacks and my required morning coffee. Jim had excellent recommendations for the area and his restaurant suggestions were spot on.
reviews.title: A place we'll always remember!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ike makes a mean breakfast and I really enjoyed getting to know the other guests and hearing about their journey's and experiences. Their home is your home, it's comfortable, clean, authentically provincial and the pools not bad either!
reviews.title: A perfect place to stay
